docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs ¶ For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands ¶ mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout ¶ mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Hi! I'm Yiyi Jiang ¶ I am a graduate student in Operations Research at Columbia University, with a dual master degree in Management Science and Engineering at Tsinghua University. I obtained my bachelor degree in Big Data Marketing at Central University of Finance and Economics. I’m passionate about tech-oriented product design and development. I built a text-audio editor iPad App for Chinese podcasters, based on my experience and observation as a podcaster. It won the national second prize in the 2022 mobile App innovation contest, but still at alpha stage that need to go through lots of iteration before publishing. Using innovative technologies to reduce unpleasant human work is always my long-term motivation, and I found product manager an ideal role that bridge technology and people’s need. That’s why as a new grad in summer 2023, I am dedicated in looking for full-time/intern opportunities as Product Manager in the US. , especially in area of productivity tool,O2O platform and AI. If you are interested in connecting, feel free to email me or message me on LinkedIn.

docs.title: Hi! I'm Yiyi Jiang

docs.text: Audioc ¶ Overview ¶ Introduction * Audioc is a Chinese text-audio editor that enable users to edit audio like a doc. It’s an iPad App built upon SwiftUI framework and Tencent ASR API. * The main user group is Chinese podcasters, who have to spend tons of hours on audio editing using traditional DAW (Digital Audio Workstation). Outcome * Audioc was built within three months during 2022 Mobile Application Innovation Contest held by Zhejiang University and Apple, and won the national second prize. * We launched the alpha version on TestFlight for internal testing, and will launch beta version to public when we are ready. Background ¶ Podcast, the combination of “iPod” and “broadcast”, is a type of audio content that expresses personal knowledge, thinking and value. Chinese podcast market is growing fast under pandemic. * Podcast creation is increasing significantly. According to MoonFM, 7,458 new Chinese podcasts born in 2020, more than the sum of previous five years. * Podcast growing potential is huge. According to ListenNotes, there are 46,000 Chinese podcasts, compared to the 1.73 million in the mature English podcast market. It means Chinese podcast market is still in its early stages and has a lot of potential for growth. Podcasting is easy to start with but time-consuming to carry on. * Anyone can be a podcaster if they are willing to express themselves, but not everyone has the ability to express well. For many people, filler words, gaps and repetitive expressions occur inadvertently in speech. These factors affect the listener experience, but removing them need lots of repetitive and time-consuming work. According to our user research, it typically took 3-4 times longer than original audio to edit. * With the help of speech recognition technique, audio can be quickly recognized and batch processed through text. There are several excellent text-audio editors, such as Descript and Spotify Soundtrap, but none of them support Chinese. Solution ¶ To use Audioc for audio editing, users only need to do the following 3 steps: set up, edit and export. * Set up * Create a project. It is a folder to store relevant audio files and their copies. * Import original audio files * Transcribe the audio files * Copy editable files from original files * Edit * Text Editor. After transcribing, the audio will be connected with text in word-level. User can manipulate the audio using text editor features, such as delete, cut, copy, and past. More importantly, we support find & delete all in one click to remove all filler words. * Track Editor. Although text editor boosts efficiency, there are still details needed to . That’s why we build track editor similar to traditional DAW to provide more flexibility, but only keep necessary features for simplicity. Specifically, we have select/cut switch, and take advantage of iPad gestures such as click, drag, magnification, and swipe. Plus, users can combine several tracks to multi track editor simply by drag and drop. * Export * Currently, we provide 2 ways to export audio: one is export to local file, the other is share to other Apps. The supported formats are m4a and mp3. Check our Figma for all pages in detail. Team ¶ Yiyi Jiang (leader): Master student in Management Science and Engineering at Tsinghua University. Took charge of market research, user study, UI design and project management. Xijie Yang: Junior student in Electronic Engineering at Tsinghua University. Take charge of iOS development. Genifer Zhao: Master student in Art at Tsinghua University. Take charge of visual design and video.
